- -
Very well.
-
That is acceptable.
-
Agreed.
-
It is agreed.
-
Good, for now.
-
Acceptable.
-
Fine.
-
You wish to hasten your demise? Splendid. Bring your lambs to my slaughter!
-
Indeed? Khorne delights in reckless courage. Come, then! Give your people's blood to the Blood God!
-
Ahaha... you know, faced with the certainty of death, I have seen some men run away, others toward it. Clearly, you are of the latter type. I have often wondered: who is wise and who is the fool? When my blade is at your throat, favour me with your thoughts on the question.
-
Ah, so you run towards death, abandoning hope that does not exist, embracing the end that is inevitable. Pay no heed to your peers: this is wisdom. I shall make it quick.
-
Your time has come. You are next.
-
I come to destroy you and your false gods. Your cities will burn, and your memory shall be obliterated!
-
I bring the End Times to your weakling empire. I will slaughter every last one of your people, and place your head on a spike to gaze over your desolate lands for eternity.
-
Impossible! How is the will of Chaos defeated?!
-
The will of the Dark Gods is undone! How has this come to pass? What ARE you?!
-
I have failed the Ruinous Powers. My warriors abandon me, and I leave the field in disgrace. Enjoy your victory, but know this: I SHALL return, and have my revenge!
-
Hahaha... fool. You may have defeated me, but you cannot stop the triumph of Chaos. You merely delay the inevitable. Another Everchosen shall rise!
-
Hand it over, maggot, and I might let you see another sunrise.
-
Give this to me, and I promise to kill you last.
-
This. Or else.
-
No.
-
No, you fool.
-
No, you weakling.
-
Absurd.
-
No. Get out of my sight.
-
Ridiculous.
-
Laughable.
-
Shut your idiot mouth.
-
Know this, mortal: any arrangement we might strike will only delay thy inevitable death at my hands, for I am Archaon, Lord of the End Times. Understanding this, what wouldst thou wish of me?
-
Bend thy knee, for thou art in the presence of Archaon, Everchosen of the Chaos Gods. A stay of execution is the most I will promise thee; for this, do bargain, and delay the end of thy days.
-
Fear me, mortal, for I am the Anointed, the Favoured Son of Chaos, the Scourge of the World. The armies of the gods rally behind me, and it is by my will and by my sword that your weakling nation shall fall.
-
Leave.
-
Get out.
-
Go away.
-
Get out of my sight.
-
Away with you.
-
Come to grovel?
-
Come to beg for something?
-
Get on your knees when you speak to me.
-
What?
-
Get on with it then go.
-
Bend thy knee.
-
Spit it out.
-
What do you want?
-
Why are you here?
-
Explain why you're wasting my time.
-
Yes?
-
You may speak.
-
What?
-
Get on with it.
-
I will conquer others for a time, but this isn't over.
-
You are stronger than you look. I congratulate you on winning a temporary respite.
-
Fear me mortals, for I am the Anointed, the favoured Son of Chaos, the Scourge of the World. The armies of the gods rally behind me, and it is by my will and by my sword that your weakling nations shall fall.
-
Sigmar was a weakling, and his Empire founded on falsehood. I shall destroy him and his false gods. The city of Ulric will burn and the memory of the upstart king shall be obliterated!
-
For this insult, I shall strangle you with your own intenstines.
-
Your nerve disgusts me. Your death shall be slow and painful.
-
How dare you. I shall disembowel your family while you watch, and then choke you with the eyeballs that witnessed their gruesome deaths.
-
A better offer might buy my indulgence for a short while.
-
I might consider an improved offer.
-
You shall give me more, and perhaps I shall turn my might on another for a time.
-
No. Do better, and perhaps I shall kill someone else first.
-
This proposal is unequal, and you insult me by pretending otherwise. This is how I choose my next victim.
-
No. Improve your proposal or die.
-
No. Grovel more. Beg more. Offer more.
-
My pat
-
I decline. Stop testing my patience.
-
Not interested.
-
Hmph.
-
Good... good.
-
Very well.
-
You can give it to me willingly and die later, or I can take it and kill you now.
-
This exchange will buy my indulgence for a short time. I trust you are wise enough to appreciate this offer.
-
This exchange will buy my indulgence for a short time.
-
You DARE make demands of me?! For this, I will flay your family alive while you watch, make rope from their skin, and with it, tie your limbs to charging horses!
-
You presume too much.
-
It is not for you to make requests of the Son of Chaos. For this, I will boil you alive.
-
Here. Choke on it. Soon, I'll take it back from your dead hands.
-
A reward for your obedience thus far is not inappropriate, I suppose. I caution you not to push your luck.
-
Fine. I'll just take it back when I'm not preoccupied.
-
Very well, craven. Your time will come, but on my terms.
-
Coward. Destroying you will clearly be even less enjoyable, or challenging, than I had thought.
-
Coward. You disgust me. Return to your cities and await the liberation my blade will bring from your wretched existence.
-
Your weakling troops fall beneath my blade. Do you not see? I cannot be stopped, only postponed.
-
The Gods are sated with your blood - for now. Rejoice, for I appoint a later time for your death.
I see your armies gather, but I see fear in your eyes. Let us dispense with the foreplay and commence with the slaughter! Find your courage! Come and DIE!
Burning your cities is time-consuming, and my dominion requires land to feed itself. You will cease your expansion immediately, abandon all hope of defiance, and accept your death at my hands.
